channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Model-based Safe Deep Reinforcement Learning via a Constrained Proximal Policy Optimization Algorithm
item.description: We compare our approach with relevant model-free and model-based approaches in Constrained RL using the challenging Safe Reinforcement Learning benchmark - the Open AI Safety Gym.

item.title: Skill-Based Reinforcement Learning with Intrinsic Reward Matching
item.description: However, often the most concise yet complete description of a task is the reward function itself, and skill learning methods learn an $\textit{intrinsic}$ reward function via the discriminator that corresponds to the skill policy.

item.title: MEGCF: Multimodal Entity Graph Collaborative Filtering for Personalized Recommendation
item.description: This paper aims at solving the mismatch problem between MFE and UIM, so as to generate high-quality embedding representations and better model multimodal user preferences.

item.title: Learning image representations for anomaly detection: application to discovery of histological alterations in drug development
item.description: Such approaches combined with pre-trained Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) representations of images were previously employed for anomaly detection (AD).

item.title: Holistic Sentence Embeddings for Better Out-of-Distribution Detection
item.description: On the basis of the observations that token averaging and layer combination contribute to improving OOD detection, we propose a simple embedding approach named Avg-Avg, which averages all token representations from each intermediate layer as the sentence embedding and significantly surpasses the state-of-the-art on a comprehensive suite of benchmarks by a 9. 33% FAR95 margin.

item.title: CAB: Comprehensive Attention Benchmarking on Long Sequence Modeling
item.description: In this paper, we propose Comprehensive Attention Benchmark (CAB) under a fine-grained attention taxonomy with four distinguishable attention patterns, namely, noncausal self, causal self, noncausal cross, and causal cross attentions.

item.title: A Comprehensive Study on Large-Scale Graph Training: Benchmarking and Rethinking
item.description: Large-scale graph training is a notoriously challenging problem for graph neural networks (GNNs).

item.title: Unsupervised Dense Nuclei Detection and Segmentation with Prior Self-activation Map For Histology Images
item.description: To this end, we propose a self-supervised learning based approach with a Prior Self-activation Module (PSM) that generates self-activation maps from the input images to avoid labeling costs and further produce pseudo masks for the downstream task.

item.title: Extracting Cultural Commonsense Knowledge at Scale
item.description: Commonsense knowledge, which is crucial for robust human-centric AI, is covered by a small number of structured knowledge projects.

item.title: PseudoReasoner: Leveraging Pseudo Labels for Commonsense Knowledge Base Population
item.description: We propose PseudoReasoner, a semi-supervised learning framework for CSKB population that uses a teacher model pre-trained on CSKBs to provide pseudo labels on the unlabeled candidate dataset for a student model to learn from.

item.title: Hierarchical Approach for Joint Semantic, Plant Instance, and Leaf Instance Segmentation in the Agricultural Domain
item.description: In this paper, we address the problem of joint semantic, plant instance, and leaf instance segmentation of crop fields from RGB data.

item.title: Safe Model-Based Reinforcement Learning with an Uncertainty-Aware Reachability Certificate
item.description: Furthermore, we build a safe RL framework to resolve constraints required by the DRC and its corresponding shield policy.

item.title: Is synthetic data from generative models ready for image recognition?
item.description: Recent text-to-image generation models have shown promising results in generating high-fidelity photo-realistic images.

item.title: Pareto-aware Neural Architecture Generation for Diverse Computational Budgets
item.description: More critically, these independent search processes cannot share their learned knowledge (i. e., the distribution of good architectures) with each other and thus often result in limited search results.

item.title: Motion-related Artefact Classification Using Patch-based Ensemble and Transfer Learning in Cardiac MRI
item.description: The final trained model was also evaluated on an independent test set by the CMRxMotion organisers, which achieved the classification accuracy of 72. 5% and Cohen's Kappa of 0. 6309 (ranked top 1 in this grand challenge).

item.title: Trailers12k: Evaluating Transfer Learning for Movie Trailer Genre Classification
item.description: In particular, we introduce Trailers12k}, a new manually-curated movie trailer dataset and evaluate the transferability of spatial and spatio-temporal representations learned from ImageNet and/or Kinetics to Trailers12k MTGC.

item.title: Multilingual Word Sense Disambiguation with Unified Sense Representation
item.description: As a key natural language processing (NLP) task, word sense disambiguation (WSD) evaluates how well NLP models can understand the lexical semantics of words under specific contexts.

item.title: Communication-Efficient Topologies for Decentralized Learning with $O(1)$ Consensus Rate
item.description: In the proposed family, EquiStatic has a degree of $\Theta(\ln(n))$, where $n$ is the network size, and a series of time-dependent one-peer topologies, EquiDyn, has a constant degree of 1.

item.title: Legal Case Document Summarization: Extractive and Abstractive Methods and their Evaluation
item.description: Summarization of legal case judgement documents is a challenging problem in Legal NLP.

item.title: Exploring Vanilla U-Net for Lesion Segmentation from Whole-body FDG-PET/CT Scans
item.description: The combination of PET-based metabolic and CT-based anatomic information can contribute to better tumor segmentation results.

item.title: MetaFill: Text Infilling for Meta-Path Generation on Heterogeneous Information Networks
item.description: Meta-path, a sequence of node types and edge types, is the core technique to embed HINs.

item.title: BERTScore is Unfair: On Social Bias in Language Model-Based Metrics for Text Generation
item.description: Automatic evaluation metrics are crucial to the development of generative systems.

item.title: TransFusion: Transcribing Speech with Multinomial Diffusion
item.description: In this work we aim to see whether the benefits of diffusion models can also be realized for speech recognition.

item.title: Empirical Study Incorporating Linguistic Knowledge on Filled Pauses for Personalized Spontaneous Speech Synthesis
item.description: We present a comprehensive empirical study for personalized spontaneous speech synthesis on the basis of linguistic knowledge.

item.title: Polycentric Clustering and Structural Regularization for Source-free Unsupervised Domain Adaptation
item.description: In this paper, a novel framework named PCSR is proposed to tackle SFDA via a novel intra-class Polycentric Clustering and Structural Regularization strategy.

item.title: Fine-grained Category Discovery under Coarse-grained supervision with Hierarchical Weighted Self-contrastive Learning
item.description: Novel category discovery aims at adapting models trained on known categories to novel categories.

item.title: Superpixel Perception Graph Neural Network for Intelligent Defect Detection
item.description: First, to capture complex and irregular textures, the images are transformed into a series of patches, to obtain their graph representations.

item.title: Expose Backdoors on the Way: A Feature-Based Efficient Defense against Textual Backdoor Attacks
item.description: In this work, we take the first step to investigate the unconcealment of textual poisoned samples at the intermediate-feature level and propose a feature-based efficient online defense method.

item.title: Weakly-Supervised Multi-Granularity Map Learning for Vision-and-Language Navigation
item.description: To achieve accurate and efficient navigation, it is critical to build a map that accurately represents both spatial location and the semantic information of the environment objects.

item.title: The Surprisingly Straightforward Scene Text Removal Method With Gated Attention and Region of Interest Generation: A Comprehensive Prominent Model Analysis
item.description: While there are a variety of different methods for STR actively being researched, it is difficult to evaluate superiority because previously proposed methods do not use the same standardized training/evaluation dataset.

item.title: When Adversarial Training Meets Vision Transformers: Recipes from Training to Architecture
item.description: We find, when randomly masking gradients from some attention blocks or masking perturbations on some patches during adversarial training, the adversarial robustness of ViTs can be remarkably improved, which may potentially open up a line of work to explore the architectural information inside the newly designed models like ViTs.

item.title: Lightweight Stepless Super-Resolution of Remote Sensing Images via Saliency-Aware Dynamic Routing Strategy
item.description: We observe that the SR difficulty of different regions in an RSI varies greatly, and existing methods use the same deep network to process all regions in an image, resulting in a waste of computing resources.

item.title: TokenMixup: Efficient Attention-guided Token-level Data Augmentation for Transformers
item.description: To this end, we propose TokenMixup, an efficient attention-guided token-level data augmentation method that aims to maximize the saliency of a mixed set of tokens.

item.title: Cross-Scale Context Extracted Hashing for Fine-Grained Image Binary Encoding
item.description: Deep hashing has been widely applied to large-scale image retrieval tasks owing to efficient computation and low storage cost by encoding high-dimensional image data into binary codes.

item.title: Vision Transformer Visualization: What Neurons Tell and How Neurons Behave?
item.description: Our approach departs from the computational process of ViTs with a focus on visualizing the local and global information in input images and the latent feature embeddings at multiple levels.

item.title: AutoMoE: Neural Architecture Search for Efficient Sparsely Activated Transformers
item.description: Motivated by the recent advances in sparsely activated models like the Mixture-of-Experts (MoE) model, we introduce sparse architectures with conditional computation into the NAS search space.

item.title: Numerically Stable Sparse Gaussian Processes via Minimum Separation using Cover Trees
item.description: In this work, we study the numerical stability of scalable sparse approximations based on inducing points.

item.title: Improving generalizability of distilled self-supervised speech processing models under distorted settings
item.description: Self-supervised learned (SSL) speech pre-trained models perform well across various speech processing tasks.

item.title: Style Transfer as Data Augmentation: A Case Study on Named Entity Recognition
item.description: In this work, we take the named entity recognition task in the English language as a case study and explore style transfer as a data augmentation method to increase the size and diversity of training data in low-resource scenarios.

item.title: HGARN: Hierarchical Graph Attention Recurrent Network for Human Mobility Prediction
item.description: To address these issues, we present Hierarchical Graph Attention Recurrent Network (HGARN) for human mobility prediction.

item.title: Distributional Reward Estimation for Effective Multi-Agent Deep Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Our main idea is to design the multi-action-branch reward estimation and policy-weighted reward aggregation for stabilized training.

item.title: Neural Routing in Meta Learning
item.description: Inspired by the widely recognized finding in neuroscience that distinct parts of the brain are highly specialized for different types of tasks, we aim to improve the model performance of the current meta learning algorithms by selectively using only parts of the model conditioned on the input tasks.

item.title: An Empirical Evaluation of Multivariate Time Series Classification with Input Transformation across Different Dimensions
item.description: We also show that if we keep the transformation method constant, there is a statistically significant difference in accuracy results when applying it across different dimensions, with accuracy differences ranging from 0. 23 to 47. 79 percentage points.

item.title: LEATHER: A Framework for Learning to Generate Human-like Text in Dialogue
item.description: From this insight, we propose a new algorithm, and empirically, we demonstrate our proposal improves both task-success and human-likeness of the generated text.

item.title: MICO: A Multi-alternative Contrastive Learning Framework for Commonsense Knowledge Representation
item.description: Commonsense reasoning tasks such as commonsense knowledge graph completion and commonsense question answering require powerful representation learning.

item.title: Kernel-Whitening: Overcome Dataset Bias with Isotropic Sentence Embedding
item.description: Dataset bias has attracted increasing attention recently for its detrimental effect on the generalization ability of fine-tuned models.

item.title: Theory and Approximate Solvers for Branched Optimal Transport with Multiple Sources
item.description: We here study the NP-hard optimization of BOT networks connecting a finite number of sources and sinks in $\mathbb{R}^2$.

item.title: A Mixture of Surprises for Unsupervised Reinforcement Learning
item.description: However, both strategies rely on a strong assumption: the entropy of the environment's dynamics is either high or low.

item.title: A Large-Scale Annotated Multivariate Time Series Aviation Maintenance Dataset from the NGAFID
item.description: To overcome this, we use the National General Aviation Flight Information Database (NGAFID), which contains flights recorded during regular operation of aircraft, and maintenance logs to construct a part failure dataset.

item.title: Scalable Neural Video Representations with Learnable Positional Features
item.description: Succinct representation of complex signals using coordinate-based neural representations (CNRs) has seen great progress, and several recent efforts focus on extending them for handling videos.
